property.name: text
property.value: 1) Open "LoadInputFiles" actor an choose the .csv files of your input data. 2) Double-click on "IFC" actor and set the dimensions of your input data. 3) Double-click on "Sigmoid" actor and set the dimensions of bias.

entity.name: weights
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: validation
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: biases
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: DiscreteClock
entity.doc: Create periodic timed events.

property.name: text
property.value: 1) Open "InputDataFC" actor an choose the .csv files (weights and biases) of the hidden layer data. 2) Double-click on "FC" actor and set the dimensions of your hidden layer input data. 3) Double-click on "Sigmoid" actor and set the dimensions of bias.

entity.name: weights
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: biases
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: DiscreteClock
entity.doc: Create periodic timed events.

property.name: text
property.value: Set the "predictions" parameter a value between 1 to "number of predictions you want to make". Set the "input_seq_size" parameter the size of the input sequence. "timesteps" parameter is the result of the input sequence size, multiplied by the number of predictions.

property.name: text
property.value: timestep_0: The first timestep of the GRU network. Here, the previous hidden state ht-1 is initialized with zeros. rest_timesteps: The next timesteps of the GRU network. Here, in each timestep, we take another input sequence and also the hidden state of the previous timestep. dense: The Dense layer in order to take the prediction results. reset: The final state, where the model finishes execution.

property.name: text
property.value: Parameters: skip: the number of lines to skip from the input file. skip2: the number of lines to skip for timestep_0 input. i: determines when to display a prediction. c: counts the number of predictions each time.

property.name: text
property.value: GRU_0: This is a GRU network implementation of the first timestep, where ht-1 is zero.

property.name: text
property.value:
Set the input dimensions by double clicking the blue bullets.
w, u = weight matrices

property.name: text
property.value: GRU: This is a GRU implementation for the rest timesteps. From now on, the GRU network has two inputs, the input of the current timestep and the hidden state from the previous timestep.

property.name: text
property.value:
Set the input dimensions by double clicking the blue bullets.
w, u = weight matrices

property.name: text
property.value: -Dense Layer- It gives the predicted value.

property.name: text
property.value: 1) Open "DenseData" actor an choose the .csv files (weights and biases) 2) Double-click on "FC" actor and set the dimensions of your input data.

entity.name: weights
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

entity.name: biases
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string

property.name: text
property.value:
For normalization, we subtracted mean and divide by standard deviation, which is: y = (input - mean)/std
Now, in order to de-normalize, we do: input = y*std + mean

entity.name: DiscreteClock
entity.doc: Create periodic timed events.

property.name: text
property.value: Set the "predictions" parameter a value between 1 to "number of predictions you want to make". Set the "input_seq_size" parameter the size of the input sequence. "timesteps" parameter is the result of the input sequence size, multiplied by the number of predictions.

entity.name: DiscreteClock
entity.doc: Create periodic timed events.

property.name: text
property.value: timestep_0: The first timestep of the LSTM network. Here, the previous hidden state ht-1 and the previous cell state ct-1 are initialized with zeros. rest_timesteps: The next timesteps of the LSTM network. Here, in each timestep, we take another input sequence and also the hidden state and the cell state of the previous timestep. dense: The Dense layer in order to take the prediction results. reset: The final state, where the model finishes execution.

property.name: text
property.value: Parameters: skip: the number of lines to skip from the input file. skip2: the number of lines to skip for timestep_0 input. i: determines when to display a prediction. c: counts the number of predictions each time.

property.name: text
property.value: LSTM: This is a LSTM implementation for the rest timesteps. From now on, the GRU network has three inputs, the input of the current timestep and the hidden state and the cell state from the previous timestep.

property.name: text
property.value:
Set the input dimensions by double clicking the blue bullets.
w, u = weight matrices
